description:
Convert ZPL files to PDF with Labelary API, TCP server mode, and multi-language support

ZPL2PDF is a powerful, cross-platform command-line tool that converts ZPL (Zebra Programming Language) files to high-quality PDF documents.

Key Features:
‚Ä¢ Multiple Rendering Engines - Offline (BinaryKits), Labelary API (high-fidelity), and Auto (fallback)
‚Ä¢ TCP Server Mode - Virtual Zebra printer on TCP port for application integration
‚Ä¢ Custom Font Support - Load TrueType/OpenType fonts for branded labels
‚Ä¢ Three Operation Modes - Conversion, daemon (auto-monitor), and TCP server (virtual printer)
‚Ä¢ Multi-language Support - 8 languages (EN, PT, ES, FR, DE, IT, JA, ZH)
‚Ä¢ Intelligent Dimension Handling - Automatic extraction from ZPL commands (^PW, ^LL)
‚Ä¢ Cross-Platform - Native support for Windows, Linux, and macOS
‚Ä¢ Clean Architecture - Built with SOLID principles and 90%+ test coverage
‚Ä¢ High Performance - Async processing with retry mechanisms
‚Ä¢ Docker Support - Optimized Alpine Linux image (470MB)

Perfect for:
‚Ä¢ Label printing workflows
‚Ä¢ Automated document generation
‚Ä¢ Enterprise label management systems
‚Ä¢ ERP integration
‚Ä¢ Virtual printer integration
‚Ä¢ Batch processing
What's New in v3.0.2:

üéâ Major Release - Labelary Integration & TCP Server

üé® Labelary API Integration:
‚Ä¢ High-fidelity ZPL rendering with exact Zebra printer emulation
‚Ä¢ Vector PDF output (smaller, higher quality files)
‚Ä¢ Automatic batching for 50+ labels with PDF merging
‚Ä¢ Smart fallback: tries Labelary first, falls back to BinaryKits if offline

üñ®Ô∏è TCP Server Mode (Virtual Printer):
‚Ä¢ Acts as a TCP printer on configurable port (default: 9101)
‚Ä¢ Perfect for integration with applications that send ZPL directly to printers
‚Ä¢ Runs independently from daemon mode (both can run simultaneously)
‚Ä¢ Background operation with foreground debug mode

üî§ Custom Font Support:
‚Ä¢ Load TrueType/OpenType fonts from directory or map specific font IDs
‚Ä¢ Support for multiple font mappings
‚Ä¢ Perfect for branded label designs

üìÅ Extended File Support:
‚Ä¢ Added support for .zpl and .imp file extensions
‚Ä¢ All extensions (.txt, .prn, .zpl, .imp) now supported

üìù Custom Output File Naming:
‚Ä¢ Control output PDF filenames directly from ZPL code
‚Ä¢ Use ^FX FileName: MyLabel in ZPL for custom naming

For detailed changes, see: https://github.com/brunoleocam/ZPL2PDF/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md
